item.title: [PI]Funpk/SafePK(continued)
item.dc:creator: @Aceron4 Aceron4
item.description:
@Aceron4 wrote:

I dont know. Just though maybe that could be part of the problem. Because if you look at your code

public boolean inWild() { if(isInFala() || isInArd() || inFunPk() || isInPvP()) { return true; }

You have “isInFala() || isInArd() || inFunPK() || isInPvP()) {”

and the inFunPk() Doesnt have the “is”

But, meh, might want to have someone whose better in java than me to take a look.

item.title: [PI]Funpk/SafePK(continued)
item.dc:creator: @blo0d_pker blo0d pker
item.description:
@blo0d_pker wrote:

was told in a previously to use this tut: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,484175.0.html
Well I did as that tut explained to do…pretty sure I did it correctly. This is what I did

I used this test area:

minimap of the test area:

The coordinates of the 2 circles on the minimap are X: 3091 Y: 3512 H: 0 & X: 3099 Y: 3508 H: 0
so for the area to be FunPk, the boolean would need to look like this:

public boolean inFunPk() { if(absX > 3093 && absX < 3099 && absY > 3512 && absY < 3508) { return true; } return false; }
And I have that done for the area I want to be FunPk, but when I go into that area you can’t attack or anything, only walk around in it, and attack NPC’s in it. anyone help?

Read full topic
